item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Coastal Clean-up Day 2020 Presentation
Sea Level Rise Story Map Presentation
subitem_blurb: Presentation of new sea level rise communication tool for the Commission’s website developed by graduate students from UC Santa Barbara Bren School of Environmental Science and Management program.

subitem_title: Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Status report and possible action on pending legislation. (JA/SC-SF)

subitem_title: Interagency Agreements for Implementing California’s Coastal Management Program, FY 2020-21 Coastal Zone Management Grant Award
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and Commission authorization to enter into Interagency Agreements with BCDC and the Coastal Conservancy to transfer federal funds to these agencies for the implementation of California Coastal Management Program for Fiscal Year 2020-21. (MJ-SF)

subitem_title: Pepperdine University Notice of Impending Development (NOID) No. PEP-NOID-0003-20 (Student Housing Wellness Center)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on NOID by Pepperdine University for a wellness center support amenity associated with the existing Seaside Residence Hall student housing facility, consisting of construction of a 5,015 sq.ft., 19 ft.-high semi-permanent membrane structure with 900 sq.ft., 19-ft.-high restroom/shower structure on concrete foundations, and associated grading (540 cu.yds. cut, 550 cu.yds. fill), retaining walls, and landscaping located on the Pepperdine University campus, Malibu, Los Angeles County. (DC-V)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission's Arcata office at (707) 826-8950.

item_title: Please note: W10a and W10b share a single combined staff report and hearing

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-20-0009-1, Part C (Crowley Site Redesignation) - Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend time limit for Commission action for up to one year on City of Eureka’s request to amend the certified LCP to change the land use designation of a portion of the Crowley site off of Hilfiker Lane from Public/Quasi-Public to General Service Commercial and the zoning district from Coastal Dependent Industrial to Service Commercial with a Qualifying Combining District. (RSM-A)

subitem_title: City of Eureka LCP Amendment No. LCP-1-EUR-20-0009-1, Part B (Service Commercial District Height Limit) - Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend time limit for Commission action for up to one year on City of Eureka’s request to amend the certified Implementation Program to increase the maximum building height within the Service Commercial Zoning District from 35 to 55 feet. (CK-A)

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.

item_title: Please note: W12b and W13a share a single combined staff report and hearing.

subitem_title: Application No. 9-20-0268 (State Lands Commission, Santa Barbara Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of State Lands Commission to permanently re-abandon 4 leaking legacy oil wells in the subtidal and intertidal zone offshore Summerland, Santa Barbara County. (DG-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 9-20-0275 (RTI Infrastructure, Inc., San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of RTI Infrastructure, Inc. to construct cable landing station and operate state waters portion of subsea fiber optic cable extending from Grover Beach, San Luis Obispo County, through state and federal waters, and terminating in Singapore, Grover Beach, San Luis Obispo County. (JW-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: CC-0002-20 (RTI Infrastructure, Inc., San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Consistency Certification by RTI Infrastructure, Inc. to construct and operate federal waters portion of fiber optic cable described above extending from Grover Beach, San Luis Obispo County, through federal waters and terminating in Singapore, Grover Beach, San Luis Obispo County. (JW-SF)

subitem_title: CC-0001-20 (San Diego Association of Governments (SANDAG), San Diego Co.)
subitem_blurb: After-the-fact Consistency Certification by SANDAG for Del Mar Bluffs Emergency Repair Project undertaken in November and December 2019 to preserve railroad trackbed support after bluff erosion temporarily halted train operations in November 2019. The submittal also includes updates on planning for future Del Mar Bluffs stabilization projects and the double track tunnel project for relocation of the railroad to an inland alignment. (LS-SF)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Appeal

item_title: Please note: W16c and W17a below, have separate staff reports but will share a single combined hearing.

subitem_title: Application No. 5-19-1220 (Dennis, Hermosa Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of George and Tallie Dennis to demolish 2-story, 1,809 sq.ft. duplex and construct new 30-ft. high, 3-story (over basement), 6,803 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 3-car garage at 3205 Highland Ave., Hermosa Beach, Los Angeles County. (AS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-20-0363 & A-5-VEN-18-0049 (Mobile Park Investment, Venice, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Application of Mobile Park Investment to demolish 2-story, approx. 22-ft. high, 4-unit residential structure with 2 detached garages and construct 3-story, 30-ft. high, 2,751 sq.ft. single-family home with approx. 500 sq.ft. junior accessory dwelling unit, detached, 2-story 1,037 sq.ft. accessory dwelling unit, and 4 on-site parking spaces, at 2812-2818 Grand Canal, Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (DZ-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-18-0554 (California Department of Fish and Wildlife, Playa Del Rey, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Dept. of Fish and Wildlife to remove unpermitted drain risers and associated lateral pipes and structures, either 1) immediately upon approval of permit, or 2) phased removal to occur within five years of Commission action on permit; Off-site restoration of 0.6 acre of willow habitat is also proposed, in Ballona Wetlands Ecological Reserve, Area B, at Playa Del Rey, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (MR-LB) (NOTE: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Permit No. 5-17-0253-A1 (California Department of Fish and Wildlife, Playa Del Rey, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Request to amend timing requirement of Special Condition 4 to remove unpermitted drains and associates pipes from one year to five years within Ballona Wetlands Ecological Reserve, Area B, at Playa Del Rey, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (MR-LB) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as is explained further in the staff report.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: City of Oxnard LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-OXN-20-0007-1 (Ventura County Harbor Department)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by Ventura County Harbor Department for an LCP amendment override of the Coastal Land Use Plan (LUP) and Coastal Zoning Ordinance of the certified City of Oxnard LCP to increase allowable density and height throughout the Harbor, and modify allowable uses and development standards to accommodate a mixed-use residential development at the Fisherman’s Wharf site within the Channel Islands Harbor. (WH-V)
subitem_status: Deny certified LUP as submitted by the County

subitem_title: City of Malibu Minor LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-MAL-20-0035-1 (Fire-Resistant Landscape Ordinance)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Malibu to amend the Local Implementation Plan (LIP) portion on its certified LCP to create fire-resistant landscape design standards. (DV-V)

subitem_title: Ventura County Channel Islands Harbor Public Works Plan Notice of Impending Development (NOID) No. CIH-NOID-0001-20 (Boater Restroom Facility Project).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on NOID by the Ventura County Harbor Department to remodel an existing 1,075 sq.ft. marina office building, construct a new 1,090 sq.ft. boater restroom facility on the north side of the remodeled marina office building, expand an existing public promenade, and modify the project description of a previously approved NOID (No. CIH-NOID-002-18) to omit an approved 450 sq.ft. boater restroom facility at the Hyatt Hotel site; located at 3700 Peninsula Rd., Channel Islands Harbor, Ventura County. (JL-V)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent and Approved with conditions

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-MAL-20-0026 (Perrin, Malibu)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by James Moore, Tracy Moore and Rody Castroll of decision of City of Malibu granting permit with conditions to Richard K. Perrin for construction of new 2,957 sq.ft. single-family home, 434 sq.ft. attached garage, and new onsite wastewater treatment system, at 21490 Paseo Portola St., Malibu, Los Angeles County. (DV-V)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-20-0151 (Jakosky, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Jack Jakosky to expand 497.19 sq. feet of approx. 3,338 sq.ft. boat dock, expand 2 gangways for ADA compliance (5’x 80’ and 4’x 24’), remove one of 12 existing boat slips, remove 3 existing concrete piles and replace 2 cracked piles, at 3101 W Coast Hwy, Newport Beach, Orange County. (JD-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-19-1016 (Mangan, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Richard Mangan to demolish one-story, 801 sq.ft., single-family home and construct new 25-ft. high, 2-story, 3,478 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 3-car garage, at 230 14th St., Seal Beach, Orange County. (AS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-20-0190 (UCSD Multi-Use Walkway, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of UC San Diego for revisions of existing shared-use pathway and parking lot to create separate paths (10 – 20 feet in width) for pedestrian and bicycles; removal of 82 parking spaces; hardscaping and landscaping improvements to 6.76-acre project area, at UCSD’s West Campus, San Diego, San Diego County. (DL-SD)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of San Clemente LUP Amendment No. LCP-5-SLC-18-0099-1 (Major Remodel Definition).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of San Clemente to amend the certified Land Use Plan (LUP) to modify the definition of Major Remodel in Chapter 7 – Definitions of the LUP. (LR-LB)

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-NPB-19-0016-1 (Parking Management Overlay District).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the request by the City of Newport Beach to amend the certified LCP Implementation Plan to create a new Parking Management Overlay District (PM Overlay) category and implementing procedures in the IP and to establish the first Parking Management District, PM-1 for the Balboa Village area of Newport Beach. (LR-LB)

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-19-0074-1 (Short-term Lodgings/Rentals).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Laguna Beach to amend the Implementation Plan (IP) portion of the certified LCP by making changes to Chapters 25.23 Short-Term Lodging, 25.10 R-1 Residential Low Density Zone, 25.12 R-2 Residential Medium Density Zone, 25.14 R-3 Residential High Density Zone, and 25.43 Village Community Zone. (MA-LB)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-NPB-20-0025 (215 Riverside Drive, LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Environmental & Regulatory Specialists, Inc. of City of Newport Beach granting permit with conditions to 215 Riverside Drive, LLC for demolition of restaurant/office building and associated surface parking lot and construction of new 40-space, 2-level parking structure and 2-story, 28-ft. high, 2,744 sq.ft. office building, at 215 Riverside Ave., Newport Beach, Orange County.
subitem_status: Substantial Issue Found, De Novo Continued

subitem_blurb: Application of HCI Systems to construct new approx. 5,600 sq.ft. single-family home on ocean-fronting, bluff property, at 31987 Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (MA-LB)

subitem_blurb: Application of Brian and Christine Leilbl to demolish 2-story, 1,120 sq.ft. single-family home with attached garage and construct 2,911 sq.ft., 3-story, 35-ft. tall, beachfront single-family home with attached 416 sq.ft., 2-car garage, at A101 Surfside Ave., Seal Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-19-1202 (Eggert & McIntire, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Steve Eggert and Deanna McIntire to remove 502 sq.ft. floating dock, 60 sq.ft. gangway, 417 sq.ft. pier and 12 square 14-in. marina guide piles and replace with new 546 sq.ft. dock, 72 sq.ft. gangway, 340 sq.ft. pier, 3 new 14-in. guide piles, and 5 new 14-in. T-piles, at 1708 & 1710 S. Bayfront, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-19-1513 (JL Oceanfront LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of JL Oceanfront LLC to construct new bulkhead on harbor front lot at harborward edge of and within existing footprint of existing brick patio, at 1120 West Bay Ave., Newport Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-20-0183 (South Orange County Wastewater Authority (SOCWA), Dana Point)
subitem_blurb: Application of SOCWA to rehabilitate San Juan Creek Ocean Outfall Junction structure to resolve structural deficiencies to prevent potential effluent leakage, at Doheny State Beach, Dana Point, Orange County. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CII-19-0145-1 (Ocean View Point).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Carlsbad to redesignate land uses on seven parcels located south of the terminus of Twain Avenue, from R-1.5 and Open Space (OS) to R-4 and OS, and then rezone the parcels from One-Family Residential with a minimum 30,000 sq.ft. lot size (R-1-30,000) and OS to One-Family Residential (R-1) and OS. (EP-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent - approved LUP and IP amendments as submitted

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-LJS-19-0198 (San Diego Children’s Pool Retaining Wall, La Jolla, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by La Jolla Community Planning Association & Ken Hunrichs from decision of City of San Diego for after-the-fact approval of 30-in. tall retaining wall substantially conforms to City’s approval for construction of new lifeguard tower at Children’s Pool Beach, La Jolla, San Diego, San Diego County. (ML-SD)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-ENC-20-0022 (Hanlon, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Commissioners  Brownsey and Hart, and Laura Walsh (Surfrider) from decision of City of Encinitas granting permit with conditions to Marco and Nicole Hanlon for demolition of 2  single-family homes on 2 adjacent lots, consolidation of lots and construction of new approx. 7,830 sq.ft. single-family home with 8,193 sq.ft. garage/subterranean garage and pool on combined 22,852 sq.ft. bluff top lot at 100 & 104 Fifth St., Encinitas, San Diego County. (CH-SD)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

subitem_title: Application No. 6-20-0154 (San Diego County Regional Airport Authority Administration Building, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of San Diego County Regional Airport Authority to demolish 3-story, 132,000 sq.ft. administration building on east side of San Diego International Airport (SDIA) and construct new 4-story, 150,000 sq.ft. administration building on paved lot on west side of SDIA, 3225 North Harbor Dr., San Diego, San Diego County. (ML-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Permit No. 6-84-496-A2 (Craig, San Diego Co.)
subitem_blurb: Request by Penelope and Cameron Craig to amend permit for construction of single-story, 3,150 sq.ft. single-family home in order to construct 1,102 sq.ft., addition, exterior deck and stairway, at 4871 Rancho Viejo Dr., Rancho Santa Fe, San Diego County. (DD-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s San Francisco office at (415) 904-5260.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-2-SMC-19-0002 (Zubieta, Moss Beach, San Mateo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Committee for Green Foothills, Stephen R. King and Jim Scheinberg of San Mateo County decision granting permit with conditions to Carlos Zubieta for construction of new 3,338 sq.ft., 2-story, single-family home with 468 sq.ft. garage on undeveloped 14,320 sq.ft. blufftop parcel adjacent to Dean Creek, at 199 Arbor Lane, in unincorporated Moss Beach area of San Mateo County. (EM-SF)
subitem_status: Substantial issue found, de novo hearing approved with conditions

subitem_title: Permit No. A-2-MAR-08-028-A3 (Lawson’s Landing Inc., Dillon Beach, Marin Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by Lawson’s Landing Inc. to amend permit to: 1) construct wastewater management system, including collection, treatment and dispersal facilities; 2) improve existing entrance, roadway, and parking facilities, including construction of storage and office buildings; 3) relocate fuel bunker; 4) allow seasonal food truck usage; 5) install emergency boat storage; 6) construct agricultural barn; 7) formally authorize removal of deteriorated pier; and 8) restore habitat, at Lawson’s Landing facility, at 137 Marine View Dr. south of Dillon Beach, Marin County. (JM/SR-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: San Luis Obispo County LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-SLO-20-0043-1 (Industrial Hemp)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by San Luis Obispo County to amend the LCP to allow for the cultivation and processing of industrial hemp within certain land use designations; add definitions related to industrial hemp; provide location and odor standards for industrial hemp cultivation; and add industrial hemp to the LCP’s existing cannabis violation and enforcement section. (BO-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. A-3-MCO-17-0068 (Monterey Bay Aquarium Research Institute (MBARI) Field Program Staging Facility, Moss Landing, Monterey Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of MBARI to develop a Field Program Staging Facility, including construction of approx. 5,200 sq.ft. storage building, 40,000 sq. feet of pavement, 3,000 cu.yds. of grading, public access improvements, and dune restoration activities, on several properties along Sandholdt Road fronting the beach and ocean in unincorporated Moss Landing area of North Monterey County. (BO-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS
